Buzz Item Text: EdWeek columnist Chuck Kerchner says NY and CA, both Common Core supporters, are heading in different directions, to the Empire State's peril.
WestEd has posted a new webinar on how to improve the Local Control and Accountability Plans by using data wisely; check it out
Video Embed Code: LCAP Webinar Part 3 – Making Data Meaningful in the LCAP from Glenn Miller on Vimeo.

Buzz Item Text: A key advisory committee to the State Board of Education voted Wednesday to swap multiple measures of school achievement for the 3-digit Academic Performance Index.
Berkeley High students complain teachers, school ignore complaints of  groping, harassment; federal rights officials investigating
Most respondents to a recent PPIC survey believe prisons are largest state expenditure; it's 9% in Brown's budget. K-12 is biggest, 42%
42 percent of adults in Public Policy Institute of California poll believe prison consumes the most spending in state budget; in reality, it's 9%; K-12 tops at 42 percent (page 19).

Buzz Item Headline: To Vax or Not to Vax
Buzz Item Text: Political cartoonist Scott Bateman made a flowchart for parents questioning whether to vaccinate their kids. SPOILER: you might laugh.
Census Bureau reports California spent proportionally more on welfare but less on education than other states, but its 10.3% spending increase in 2012-13 topped nation.
Mercury News writer Sharon Nogucihi reports on districts that are moving to free, online content, posing a threat to traditional textbook publishers.
Studentsâ€™ confidence in their ability to land a "good job" after graduation declines as they get older, according to a new Gallup Student Poll.
Vaccine safety evidence from American Academy of Pediatrics. Will make you laugh...if you're not a naysayer, that is.
Pollster and PPIC President Mark Baldassare says any hope of extending the state's temporary tax increase will ride on whether voters believe schools are using dollars smartly.

Michael Towne, a science teacher at Citrus Hill High School in Mead Valley, will speak tomorrow at a forum in Washington, D.C., on the reauthorization of the No Child Left Behind law. The event was organized by the U.S. House Committee on Education and Workforce.
Teachers at Oakland Unified are working the bare minimum required as they negotiate with officials over a new contract; the sticking point is pay.
Check out this cartoon from the 1930s about the debate over the rollout of a smallpox vaccine.

Nick Schweizer, a longtime administrator in the Department of Finance and former executive director of the State Board of Education, was named Wednesday as deputy superintendent of administration and finance in the California Department of Education.
California science teacher Michael Towne called for more access for minorities to science and math courses in testimony on Capitol Hill on revising NCLB. Read his remarks.
NPR education team shares stories of the teachers who shaped their lives.

Want to know which states are using the Smarter Balanced Assessments aligned to the Common Core, and which are using the Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for Common Core? Education Week has published this handy map. Check it out.

Buzz Item Headline: Michelle Obama gives a shout out to counselors
Buzz Item Text: The First Lady talks about the two worlds of high schools -- one where it's not whether you go to college but where. The second, more populated world has overstretched counselors, with a national average of 471 to 1.
Once-indicted Superintendent Charlie Mae Knight returns to Ravenswood as board member. Trouble in her era included fed oversight of special ed.
SF Unified says the number of suspended African-American students is down 17 percent since last school year. District credits improved school climate and efforts to reduce disproportionality. .
Sandra Gutierrez, founder of Abriendo Puertas/Opening Doors, a Los Angeles parent training program, is one of this year's winners of the James Irvine Foundation's Leadership Awards.
Bill and Melinda Gates on the ripple effect of educating girls.
